details.title: Kamal Haasan to make a 'special announcement'
details.content: As mentioned by the actor's spokesperson, Kamal Haasan will make a "special announcement" at the GRT Convention Center, T. Nagar.

details.title: 'Ulaganayagan' explains why he won't celebrate his birthday
details.content:
As an explanation, 'Ulaganayagan' Kamal Haasan tweets a quote which says: "Tomorrow, is just another day if you just celebrate and fail to seize it. If we can make it better in pursuit of a cause then we become the change we seek."

To those who love me and dislike the idea of my cancelling my birthday celeberations pic.twitter.com/hkSPJj97C9

— Kamal Haasan (@ikamalhaasan) November 6, 2017

details.title: Detect diseases before it becomes epidemic: Kamal Haasan
details.content:
The veteran actor talks about the importance of medical camps at the campby Narpani Iyakkam. 

Govt arranging water outlets in water logged areas. Equally important, medical camps detect diseases before it becomes epidemic:Kamal Haasan pic.twitter.com/gOHnwwXm4b

— ANI (@ANI) November 7, 2017
IN PICS | On Kamal Haasan's 63rd birthday, here are some of his films that ran into controveries

details.title: Kamal Haasan comments on
details.content: The actor sharpened his attack on right wing leadership in his column in a Tamil magazine last week. He said that the existence of Hindu terror cannot be denied. Read more

details.title: Kamal Haasan to launch a mobile app to connect with fans
details.content: The actor held back on the details of when he would launch his own party but said the application would be the first step in his political journey. He also said on Sunday that the app will track all financial transactions.
On November 1st, Kamal Haasan met with his fan association members. In the meeting he discussed welfare activities that have been planned for his birthday across Tamil Nadu. READ FULL REPORT HERE

Stage set for @ikamalhaasan #Kamal ji s press meet any time it will start @diamondbabu4 pic.twitter.com/jWAIZVBvvf

— rgvenkateshgnfilms (@rgvenkateshgnfi) November 7, 2017

On October 28th, Kamal Haasan visited Ennore in the early hours without any media glare. He also interacted with the residents there, particularly women and youth, and enquired with them about the impact of encroachments on the Kosasthalaiyar river and the effluents being discharged by the thermal power plants. READ MORE

details.title: My vision is that I want to bring out that #virtuouscycle: Kamal Haasan
details.content: Kamal Haasan begins his announcement by talking about a "virtuous cycle"

details.title: Kamal Haasan launches #maiamwhistle
details.content: The actor launches his mobile application as his "first step towards politics. The application is called "Maiamwhistle" which is a citizen's platform to enable whistleblowing and strengthening the citizen's voice. He says, "whistle" is an object that is used when something wrong happens.

details.title: I am not doing this for myself, but for the people: Ulaganayagan
details.content: I discussed this with many experts before creating this application. I hope it will set up a good foundation to future endeavours: Kamal Haasan
I have come to a point where I should prove the purpose of my birth, and I am sure that I will get support from you: Kamal Haasan

details.title: Kamal talks about Thedi Theerpom Vaa
details.content: The actor says that he had written a book many years ago called " Thedi Theerpom Vaa". He said that he wrote it with the help of his association members which describes how to go about about solving issues in the society.

"Naming the political party is not essential now. I'm doing the groundwork steadily, which is more important," says #KamalHaasan #KH pic.twitter.com/klfRV529mR

— CinemaExpress (@XpressCinema) November 7, 2017

"I have plans to travel across Tamil Nadu to understand people's problems" says #KamalHaasan in the pressmeet #KH

— CinemaExpress (@XpressCinema) November 7, 2017

On Friday, the Veteran actor came forward in thanking the Chennai police for going out of the way to help people to battle the flood situation in Tamil Nadu.

Thanks for going beyond the call of your duty. Good citizens shine with or without uniform. More similar Thamizhan's should report to duty pic.twitter.com/54StA3CEq0

— Kamal Haasan (@ikamalhaasan) November 4, 2017

details.title: #Maiamwhistle to go live in January 2018
details.content:
"The whistle-blower app will be launched formally in January, after beta-testing is done, and every issue is resolved," says #KamalHaasan pic.twitter.com/ynOdzdMXzV

— CinemaExpress (@XpressCinema) November 7, 2017

details.title: Kamal Haasan talk about his comment on
details.content:
I definitely don't want to hurt Hindu sentiments, as I myself belong to a Hindu family,but have taken a different path: #KamalHaasan pic.twitter.com/rFtkfXCRuY

details.title: Ulaganayagan promises to complete his films
details.content:
"I will definitely finish my pending film commitments. They are all well-publicized already," says #KamalHaasan #KH #maiamwhistle pic.twitter.com/NisEQVU1jF

— CinemaExpress (@XpressCinema) November 7, 2017

details.title: Will start Tamil Nadu tour from January 2018: Kamal Haasan
details.content:
"I'll start my TN tour to interact directly with the people from January 2018," says #KamalHaasan, while elaborating about his future plans pic.twitter.com/qEFYdE1MgH

— CinemaExpress (@XpressCinema) November 7, 2017

On Saturday, the veteran actor spoke at an All Farmers Coordination Committee meeting and announce that he would extend support to farmers and promised mobilisation of “five lakh friends’’ in the coming days to help them. READ MORE
Lot of talks around the house that Yeddyurappa may resign as soon as house reconvenes and head to Raj Bhavan to submit resignation to speaker.
House adjourned till 3.30 PM. 207 MLA's have taken oath till now.
Two missing MLA's both from Congress, fail to turn up till the time the house was adjourned for lunch.
